title: Police officer ‘seriously wounded’ in Liège shooting
text:
According to Belgian public service broadcaster RTBF, the incident happened in Rue de Visé, in the eastern outskirts of the city, when a police patrol questioned a driver who appeared drowsy | Bruno Fahy/AFP via Getty Images Police officer ‘seriously wounded’ in Liège shooting The shooting happened during what police described as a routine traffic stop.

A shootout in the Belgian city of Liège on Monday morning left one police officer in critical condition while the assailant was shot dead, local media reported.

The officer was "seriously wounded" during a "routine intervention" the police of Liège tweeted. According to Belgian public service broadcaster RTBF, the incident happened in Rue de Visé, in the eastern outskirts of the city, when a police patrol questioned a driver who appeared drowsy.

The suspect opened fire and shot the police officer in the head. A second police officer returned fire and killed the attacker, according to RTBF.

The Liège prosecutors office declined to comment, saying it would release more information at a press conference around midday.

In May last year, two policemen and a civilian were shot by an attacker in Liège. The terrorist group Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
